title: Neon code-rendered joystick, shoot button, and player ship (remove image dependencies)

requirements.summary: Replace joystick visuals with fully code-rendered neon UI while preserving existing joystick input behavior and lifecycle resets.
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/src/game/controls/Joystick.tsx no longer renders joystick-base/knob images from /assets/generated (no usage for the joystick UI).
The joystick still reports normalized x/y movement in the same range as before and resets to (0,0) on end/visibility/orientation/resize changes.
The joystick remains visually bright/attractive with a neon/glow look consistent with the current UI theme.
The joystick remains usable with both touch and mouse input and continues to prevent browser scrolling while interacting (touchAction/PreventDefault behavior preserved).

file_operations.description: Remove joystick usage and replace base/knob with code-rendered elements (e.g., divs with gradients, borders, and glow via existing Tailwind theme colors), while keeping all existing event listeners, preventDefault behavior, normalized x/y math, and lifecycle resets unchanged.
Add/adjust Tailwind utility classes (under @layer utilities) to support a consistent neon/glow joystick look (e.g., reusable glow/ring utilities), without changing gameplay control logic.

requirements.summary: Replace SHOOT button visuals with fully code-rendered neon UI while preserving press/hold/release behavior and event coverage.
acceptanceCriteria: Press-and-hold shooting continues to work: onShootStart fires once per press; onShootEnd fires on release/cancel/leave to avoid stuck shooting.
Button visuals are bright and attractive (neon/glow, clear label), and remain readable at typical mobile sizes.
Button remains functional with both touch and mouse events.

file_operations.description: Remove the bolt icon and replace it with a code-rendered graphic (e.g., inline SVG or pure CSS shapes) plus neon/glow styling; keep all existing touch/mouse handlers and the ‘fire once per press’ ref logic intact.
Extend existing neon utility styles as needed so the SHOOT button’s code-rendered icon/label has a bright, readable glow at mobile sizes, without altering input behavior.

requirements.summary: Replace player ship image drawing with a code-rendered neon Canvas 2D ship while preserving rotation and readability across radii.
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/src/game/render/GameCanvas.tsx no longer loads or draws /assets/generated/player-ship.dim_256x256.png (no ship Image() usage).
The player ship is drawn via Canvas 2D code (e.g., vector/shape-based) with a bright neon/glow appearance consistent with the game theme.
Ship rotation continues to visually match the player rotation value during gameplay.
No regression to gameplay rendering performance (no obvious stutter introduced by the new drawing routine).

file_operations.description: Remove ship Image() loading/caching and implement a Canvas 2D vector ship drawing routine (path-based shapes with stroke/fill + controlled shadowBlur) that scales with player radius and renders under the existing translate/rotate transform to preserve rotation behavior and performance.

requirements.summary: Remove runtime dependencies on generated joystick/shoot/ship image assets while keeping other generated assets and gameplay overlay stacking unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: No runtime console errors for missing joystick/shoot/player image assets during gameplay.
Menu screen and other UI that uses generated assets (background, logo, trophy) remains unchanged and continues to render correctly.
Gameplay screen continues to render touch controls above the canvas (existing overlay stacking behavior remains).

file_operations.description: Ensure no remaining references to /assets/generated/joystick-base.dim_512x512.png or /assets/generated/joystick-knob.dim_256x256.png exist in the joystick UI implementation, while preserving the same DOM layering and pointer-events behavior.
Ensure no remaining references to /assets/generated/icon-bolt.dim_256x256.png exist in the SHOOT button UI implementation, while preserving touchAction and overlay usability.

Ensure no remaining references to /assets/generated/player-ship.dim_256x256.png exist in gameplay rendering; keep the canvas placement and z-index behavior unchanged so the touch overlay continues to sit above it.
